thread.title: Ted Cruz Causes A Stir By Suggesting That The Supeme Court Will Have Another Vacancy Soon
thread.title_full: Ted Cruz Causes A Stir By Suggesting That The Supeme Court Will Have Another Vacancy Soon

author: Christine Rousselle
title: Ted Cruz Causes A Stir By Suggesting That The Supeme Court Will Have Another Vacancy Soon
text:
Ted Cruz Causes A Stir By Suggesting That The Supeme Court Will Have Another Vacancy Soon Share Share Tweet 
Speaking at CPAC, Sen. Ted Cruz (R-TX) caused a minor stir when he said that President Trump may be filling another Supreme Court vacancy come summertime. Cruz predicted an "Armageddon meltdown" on the left if this were to be the case. . @tedcruz predicts there will be another Supreme Court vacancy this summer. #CPAC2017 pic.twitter.com/kdV6F4YLle — World News Tonight (@ABCWorldNews) February 23, 2017 
Given that vacancies on the Supreme Court generally come following the death of one of the justices, many people were concerned that " Zodiac Ted " had picked his latest victim. I found Ted Cruz’s prediction about the second Supreme Court vacancy pic.twitter.com/RcIvHVILFf — Eric Reif (@esreif) February 23, 2017 Another Supreme Court vacancy this summer? Great talk at #CPAC2017 by Ted Cruz, revealing his true identity was bold and unexpected. pic.twitter.com/ixwChTcUng — Deplorable Stefan (@escalibran) February 23, 2017 Is @tedcruz planning to kill a Supreme Court justice? https://t.co/OTFZ6STBgY — Joe Bua (@JoeWatchesTV) February 23, 2017 . @tedcruz predicts another Supreme Court vacancy this summer without explaining if he predicts a death or retirement — Kelly O'Donnell (@KellyO) February 23, 2017 Ted Cruz: "I think we'll have another Supreme Court vacancy this summer." Tittering as people try to figure out who he is going to kill — Daniel Dale (@ddale8) February 23, 2017 
Granted, it's probably more likely that Cruz has some kind of insider knowledge about a justice considering retirement come summer. Given that there are two justices over the age of 80, and one who is 78, it's not infeasible that one would be looking towards retirement in the near future. (But it's certainly more fun to dig out the "Ted Cruz is the Zodiac Killer" jokes.) 
While his comment was awkwardly worded, he does make an excellent point that nobody is really talking about: Trump could be filling a lot of seats on the Supreme Court in the very near future. This will potentially change the makeup of the Supreme Court for a generation or more. The average life expectancy in the U.S. is just over 78. A full third of the court is older than that, and Justice Clarence Thomas will be 72 at the end of Trump's first term. The left likely will go "full Armageddon" if one of the justices that either passes away or retires is on the liberal wing of the court. Elections have consequences--and this is likely the biggest one.
